content: So, I was chatting with @nikomatsakis in PMs about possible turning on the binder validation logic in rustc on nightly for like a week. I'll copy some of those messages here, in case others want to discuss
Well, might be easier to just summarize:

• The biggest downside of turning it on is the (likely) big perf hit (it's currently only in debug builds)
  • We should probably add a -Z validate-bound-vars flag or something that's opt-in, and announce it in a blog post
  • This blog post would be a good time to also discuss "GATs are no longer incomplete" (when we get there), TAIT, etc.
